results.title: Snowbound
results.creator_credit: Linda Gottlieb, Learning Corporation of America and Robert Young
results.brief_description: A shortened version of the motion picture “Snowbound”. Features two teenagers who learn to understand themselves and each other when they are caught in a desolate area during a snow storm. Written by Edward Pomerantz and Kurt Villadsen from the book by Harry Mazer.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Linda Gottlieb, Learning Corporation of America and Robert Young

results.title: Snow thrills
results.creator_credit: Eugene W. Castle and Castle Films
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items: ice skating from coast to coast; ice yachts; Siberian sled dogs race; polar bears; ski thrills; cross-country skiing in Canada; longest bob-sled takes kids to town; bob-sledding at 60 miles per hour.

results.title: Snow camp
results.creator_credit: Tasmanian State Film Unit and National Fitness Council of Tasmania
results.brief_description: Aimed at the experienced bushwalker, this film discusses survival in the snow country. Includes instructions on the building of igloos and other shelters. Suitable for upper secondary and teertiary levels.

results.title: Snow
results.brief_description: Shows scenes of a snow blanketed countryside, trees laden with snow, snow melting on bushes, a mountain stream half-covered with snow and ice and footsteps in the snow. No narration - music only. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Snow
results.creator_credit: Edgar H. Anstey, British Railways and Geoffrey Jones
results.brief_description: An impressionistic film, with no commentary and with visuals set against a rhythmic music background. Shows a train ploughing through snow country and the work of track gangs to maintain services during a severe winter. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Edgar H. Anstey, British Railways and Geoffrey Jones

results.title: Snofari
results.creator_credit: New Zealand National Film Unit, Geoffrey Scott, Ronald Bowie and Grant Foster
results.brief_description: A visitor to New Zealand and a friend spend a week in Queenstown in winter. They enjoy the winter sports of skiing and skating. They also hike over the surrounding countryside, visit the lakes and take a trip on the steamer, “Earnslaw”.
results.creator_credit_for_label: New Zealand National Film Unit, Geoffrey Scott, Ronald Bowie and Grant Foster

results.title: Sniffles and sneezes
results.brief_description: Explains that colds are the result of viruses, portrays common ways of spreading cold germs, and illustrates how the body defends itself against germs. Shows how to prevent colds and what to do if a cold has started.
results.description: Explains that colds are the result of viruses, portrays common ways of spreading cold germs, and illustrates how the body defends itself against germs. Shows how to prevent colds and what to do if a cold has started.

results.title: Snakes and how they live
results.brief_description: Relates major pertinent concepts about snakes, using a great variety of types to show how they move, eat, shed skin, etc. An open-ended approach stimulates class discussion. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Snake bite
results.brief_description: An interactive war game set in Iraq. You are a soldier and your mission is to intercept a rebel force planning an attack on Al Hilhah, south of Baghdad, and destroy this terrorist threat before they are able to kill any of the city’s civilians.
